data.title: Gold Futures Show Little Reaction to Inflation Report
data.text: Despite slight upside move, gold market sentiment remains bearish with little impact from the inflation report.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD resumes its downtrend toward $1,825
data.text: Gold price is resuming its downtrend below $1,850 in Wednesday's trading so far. $1,825 remains in sight for XAU/USD bears, as FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta notes.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD touches its lowest level since January, remains vulnerable
data.text: Gold price comes under some renewed selling pressure on Wednesday and remains on the defensive heading into the European session. The XAU/USD is currently placed just below the $1,845 level, flirting with its lowest level since January 6 touched in the last hour, and seems vulnerable to decline further.

data.title: Gold Futures: Extra gains on the cards
data.text: CME Group's flash data for gold futures markets noted traders extended the downtrend for yet another session on Tuesday, this time by just 121 contracts. Volume, instead, reversed two daily pullbacks in a row and increased by around 83.6K contracts.

data.title: Gold Prices Looked Past an Inflation Beat, But Broader Outlook Remains Bearish
data.text: Gold prices finished flat on Tuesday despite an unexpectedly strong US CPI report as markets were also focused on Fedspeak. Down the road, the path for XAU/USD may remain tilted lower.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast XAU/USD – Stubborn US Inflation Data Adding to Rate-Hike Worries
data.text: Gold prices are being pressured by fears the U.S. central bank will need to keep gradually raising interest rates to beat inflation.

data.title: Gold Price Faces Key Challenges, US CPI Declined To 6.4%
data.text: Gold price struggled to start a recovery wave above $1,870 against the US Dollar. The price made a couple of attempts, but the bulls failed to clear $1,865 and $1,870.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD rebound appears elusive below $1,880 – Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) renews its intraday high near $1,860, following a bounce off a 1.5-month low, as market players react to the softer US inflation data during early Wednesday. That said, the yellow metal witnessed a volatile Tuesday but ended up with 0.04% intraday gains as the Federal Reserve (Fed) officials reiterated their hawkish bias despite the lowest US Consumer Price Index (CPI) increase since 2021.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eyes further downside on hawkish Federal Reserve talks
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) prints mild losses around the mid-$1,800s, fading the bounce off a 1.5-month low, as traders await more clues to extend the United States inflation-inflicted downside during early Wednesday. Even so, the hawkish Federal Reserve comments and technical breakdown keep the XAU/USD bears hopeful of keeping the reins ahead of the US Retail Sales.

data.title: Gold, Silver, Platinum – Precious Metals Decline As Treasury Yields Rise
data.text: Traders react to the higher-than-expected U.S. inflation reports, which indicated that inflation remained a serious problem.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast – Gold Markets Bounce From the 50-Day EMA
data.text: Gold markets have gone back and forth during the trading session on Tuesday as we are hovering around the 50-Day EMA.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD pops on the knee jerk to US CPI and Fed expectations
data.text: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD pops on the knee jerk to US CPI and Fed expectations

data.title: Why Isn't Gold Responding to Uncertainty?
data.text: There are a lot of reasons for investors to seek safe havens, particularly recently. But gold has struggled to reach the $1,900/oz level.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast XAU/USD – Traders Bracing for Volatile Reaction to US CPI Data
data.text: If inflation comes in lower than expected, traders are likely to scale back their interest rate expectations, which could be supportive for gold.

data.title: Gold Price Setup Ahead of US CPI: Bear Flag Hints at Further Downside
data.text: Gold prices sold off in the wake of better-than-expected US data and the emergence of a bear flag suggests that selling may continue. US CPI up next

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD to advance nicely on falling US inflation – Commerzbank
data.text: Gold price dropped yesterday to $1,850, its lowest level since early January. Soft United States Consumer Price Index could scale back hawkish Federal Reserve bets, allowing the yellow metal to rise, strategists at Commerzbank report.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD clings to gains above $1,860, focus remains on US CPI report
data.text: Gold price attracts some buying on Tuesday and recovers a major part of the previous day's slide to the $1,850 level, or its lowest level since January 6. The XAU/USD sticks to modest intraday gains through the first half of the European session and is currently trading just above the $1,860 level, up nearly 0.50% for the day.

data.title: Investors Are Anticipating the CPI Report and Its Potential Impact on Gold Prices.
data.text: Investors are eagerly awaiting the January CPI inflation report, set to be released by the BLS in under 24 hours on February 14 at 8:30 EST. This report will shed light on the US CPI data for the previous month.

data.title: Gold Futures: Extra decline not ruled out
data.text: Open interest in gold futures markets rose by just 375 contracts for the first time since February 2 on Monday, according to preliminary readings from CME Group. Volume, instead, shrank for the second consecutive session, this time by nearly 25K contracts.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD to sink toward $1,825 on hotter-than-expected US CPI
data.text: Gold price rebounds from week lows at $1,850. But XAU/USD could resume drop toward $1,825 on hot US Consumer Price Index, FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta reports.
